generalInfo:
This tour is specially tailored to provide the best of Bhutan’s and Nepal's timeless culture and traditions. You will experience Bhutan’s unique rich culture with visits to beautiful fortresses, museums and visits to farmhouses, experience local cuisine, relaxing hot stone bath after a tiring day, hike up to the famous

Taktshang Monastery popularly known as Tiger’s nest. Travel between lush green valleys’ to dense forest. Discover some of the most sacred Buddhist monasteries, temples and marvel at the ancient paintings and carvings in fortress and temples.
You will visit all 7 UNESCO World Heritage sites in Kathmandu Valley to feel the core of Nepal, culture and history.
If you're short on time, then this tour is definitely for you!
***
Price includes in Bhutan:
• Carefully selected 3* hotel accommodation;
• Deluxe room with twin sharing basis;
• Personal specialized licensed English speaking guide & driver;
• Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner (excluding alcoholic drinks & soft drinks);
• Excellent SUV for transportation throughout the tour;
• All entrance fees & sightseeing including Monasteries & Dzongs/fortress etc.;
• Bhutan Government daily royalties, and other taxes;
• Tea, Snacks and Mineral water all time during the tour.
In Nepal:
• 2-nights’ accommodation in Kathmandu in a 3-star hotel with breakfast on a twin sharing basis;
• Sightseeing on a private vehicle with an English speaking guide in Kathmandu during Day 1 and Day 2;
• Airport transfers on Day 1 and Day 3;
• Welcome dinner;
• All taxes.
***
Price excludes:
• lunches and dinners in Kathmandu;
• International flights to Nepal and Bhutan;
• visa fee to Nepal ($30); Bhutan ($40)
• travel insurance;
• entrance fees during sightseeing in Kathmandu
• bills of personal nature;
• tips for guides and drivers.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL PLUS SIGHTSEEING Upon arrival, our representatives will be at the Tribhuvan international airport to welcome and escort you to the hotel. We then head out for Kathmandu sightseeing. Capital of the country, Kathmandu is home to 7 UNESCO world heritage sites. Throughout the day we will visit some of the heritage sites. Sights to visit: Bouddhanath Stupa and Pashupatinath Temple. Overnight in Kathmandu.

KATHMANDU VALLEY SIGHTSEEING After breakfast, our full-day tour of the best-preserved cultural heritage sites begins. Our tour starts from the traditional city of Bhaktapur (UNESCO World Heritage Site), then heads towards the oldest city of Kirtipur, and ends with the visit to the major attractions of the historical city Patan (UNESCO World Heritage Site). Overnight in Kathmandu.

ARRIVE PARO – THIMPHU (1-hour drive) The flight to Paro is one of the most spectacular mountain flights in the world, with a constantly changing panorama of some of the highest mountains on earth. Arrive at Paro and drive to Thimphu. Depending on the time of arrival, we'll go for sightseeing. Overnight in Thimphu;

THIMPHU VALLEY SIGHTSEEING After breakfast, visit the world’s tallest sitting Buddha statue at Buddha point which is 169 feet tall. After lunch visit Simply Museum, a “living” museum, Simply Bhutan is an initiative of the Bhutan Youth Development Fund that aims to increase young Bhutanese people's engagement with their traditional culture. Later visit Painting School the Institute offers you a glimpse of novices learning 13 traditional arts and crafts of Bhutan. Visit the traditional paper making factory. Overnight in Thimphu;

THIMPHU TO PUNAKHA VALLEY (2 hours’ drive) Today after breakfast you will drive to Punakha (1300m/4265ft) the former capital of Bhutan. On the way after 45 minutes? drive from Thimphu will reach the highest pass between Thimphu and Punakha the place called Dochula pass (3140m). One can see many snow-covered 7000 meter peaks, including Gangkhar Phuensum, the world's highest unclimbed mountain. Gasa Dzong also appears in the distance. Upon reaching Punakha valley visit Punakha Dzong the impressive Dzong built-in 1637 by Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal to serve as the religious and administrative centre of the region. After visiting the Punakha Dzong take a leisurely walk for 5 to 10 minutes to reach the longest suspension bridge of Bhutan. We have a great view of villages on the other side of the river. Overnight in Punakha;

PHOBJIKHA VALLEY TOUR 2.5 hours’ drive Today after breakfast drive towards Phobjikha Valley. On arrival, visit Gangtey Goempa, the oldest Nyingmapa temple in western Bhutan. Gangtey Goemba sits on the crest of a hill, overlooking majestic views of the Phobjikha Valley. Quite appropriately, its name means simply “the temple on the hilltop. Then explore the valley on foot is the best way to experience Gangtey as you will walk by small villages and picturesque scenery. Later visit Crane Information Centre which gives all the information about birds. Do the Nature Trail hike which is around 2 km to enjoy the valley and meet with the locals and enjoy the fresh lush green vegetation all around Bhutan. Overnight in Punakha;

PUNAKHA TO PARO (2 hours’ drive) After early breakfast, drive back to Paro, upon reaching Paro visit National Museum and the Ringpung Dzong. Later visit Kyichu temple, one of the oldest temples in Bhutan which was built in the 7th century, and in the evening stroll around the main street for some interesting Himalayan artefacts or textiles or have a relaxing stay in the hotel. Overnight in Paro;

HIKE TO TIGER’S NEST After breakfast hike to Taktsang Monastery. The walk of approximately 1.5 to 2 hours uphill takes you almost a kilometre above the Paro valley floor (for those who cannot hike we will arrange a horse for transfer up to cafeteria). From a distance, Bhutan's most iconic building seems to float, weightless, halfway up a sheer cliff-face, 900 meters (3,000 feet) above the floor of the Paro Valley. Later in the evening enjoy a relaxing hot stone bath to relax your sore muscles after the hike (extra charges applicable). Overnight in Paro;
DEPART PARO Breakfast in the hotel, then drive to the airport for a flight to your onward destination. Tashi Delek !
